translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Paṇṇadāyaka
The Story of the Elder Buddhupaṭṭhāyika

analyzed: veṭambhinī iti me nāma  pitu santam mamam tadā
translated: “My name was Veṭambhinī,🔽and I was the daughter of my father then.

analyzed: upānayi mahā muni  imā imam uddisissanti
translated: the Great Sage led me to him.🔽These Buddhas, leaders of the world,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of my service.
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Buddhupaṭṭhāyika recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā buddhupaṭṭhāyiko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Buddhupaṭṭhāyikattherassāpadānaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā buddhupaṭṭhāyikaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽buddhupaṭṭhāyika therassa apadānam navama
translated: The story of the elder Buddhupaṭṭhāyika is the ninth.
